quality.largeFilesSlower: Large files may take longer to process
quality.considerLowerResolution: Consider using a lower resolution or compressing the image
quality.useHigherResolution: Use a higher resolution image or better camera settings
quality.getCloserToLesion: Use a higher resolution camera setting or get closer to the lesion
quality.autoOptimized: Image will be automatically optimized for processing
quality.willCompress: Image will be compressed for optimal analysis speed
quality.tryDifferentImage: Try selecting a different image in JPEG or PNG format
quality.frameMoreSquare: Try to frame the lesion in a more square composition
quality.ensureFocused: Ensure the camera is focused and steady when taking the photo
quality.useGoodLighting: Use good lighting and avoid camera shake
quality.lowQualityForAnalysis: Image may be too low quality for accurate analysis
quality.inaccurateAnalysis: Low resolution may result in inaccurate analysis
quality.corruptedOrUnsupported: Image may be corrupted or unsupported format
quality.narrowOrWide: Very narrow or wide images may not capture lesion details properly
quality.blurOrCompression: Low file size relative to resolution suggests blur or compression artifacts

riskLevels.routineMonitoring: Routine monitoring - consult dermatologist if changes occur
riskLevels.seekAttentionPromptly: Seek medical attention promptly. Highly contagious - take precautions.
riskLevels.consultHealthcare: Consult healthcare provider. Follow hygiene protocols if contagious.
riskLevels.monitorCondition: Monitor condition. Consult healthcare provider if symptoms worsen.

confidence.veryLowStronglyRecommend: Very low confidence - dermatologist evaluation strongly recommended

pdf.disclaimerText: This AI analysis is for educational and research purposes only. It is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. This report should not be used as a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the advice of a qualified dermatologist or healthcare provider regarding any skin lesions or medical conditions. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay in seeking it because of information provided in this report.
pdf.footerGenerated: Generated by Skin Lesion Analysis App â€¢ AI-Powered Dermatological Assessment
pdf.footerConsultation: For medical consultation, please contact a qualified dermatologist

quality.title: Image Quality Check
quality.acceptable: Image quality is acceptable for analysis

photoTips.title: Professional Photography Tips
photoTips.fillFrame: Fill the frame with the lesion, leaving some surrounding skin visible
photoTips.lighting: Use natural lighting or bright, even artificial light
photoTips.steady: Hold the camera steady and ensure the image is in focus
photoTips.distance: Maintain consistent distance (6-12 inches from lesion)

diagnosis.title: Diagnosis
diagnosis.aiDiagnosisHelp: This is the primary diagnosis predicted by the AI model. The model analyzes the image using deep learning to classify the lesion type. This is a preliminary assessment and should be confirmed by a qualified dermatologist.
diagnosis.confidenceLevelHelp: Confidence indicates how certain the AI model is about its prediction. Higher confidence (>90%) suggests more reliable predictions, while lower confidence (<60%) indicates uncertainty and requires dermatologist consultation. Confidence is calculated using Monte Carlo Dropout for robust uncertainty quantification.

risk.title: Risk Assessment
risk.helpContent: Risk level is determined based on the predicted lesion type and confidence. High-risk lesions (melanoma, carcinomas) require immediate dermatologist consultation. Moderate-risk lesions should be evaluated within 2-4 weeks. Low-risk lesions need routine monitoring. This assessment is based on AI analysis and should be confirmed by a medical professional.

uncertainty.title: Prediction Reliability Analysis
uncertainty.quantificationHelp: This section quantifies how reliable the AI prediction is using Monte Carlo Dropout. Model Uncertainty (epistemic) reflects limitations in the model's knowledge. Data Uncertainty (aleatoric) reflects noise in the image. Lower uncertainty values indicate more reliable predictions. This advanced technique provides more trustworthy assessments than simple confidence scores.

differential.title: Differential Diagnoses
differential.helpContent: These are alternative diagnoses ranked by probability including lesion classification, inflammatory conditions, and infectious diseases. Each diagnosis includes severity level, urgency, and description to guide clinical decision-making.
differential.rankedByProbability: Ranked by probability from most to least likely

treatment.title: Treatment Recommendations
treatment.helpContent: These are evidence-based treatment recommendations generated by our clinical decision support system. Recommendations are personalized based on the diagnosis, severity, and patient factors. Always consult with a healthcare professional before starting any treatment.

clinicalSupport.title: Clinical Decision Support
clinicalSupport.helpContent: AI-powered clinical decision support provides diagnostic reasoning, treatment pathways, and evidence-based recommendations. This system integrates multiple data sources including diagnosis confidence, risk assessment, and medical guidelines to assist healthcare providers in making informed decisions.

bodyMapSelector.title: Select Lesion Location
bodyMapSelector.subtitle: Mark the location of the lesion on the body map

userGuide.title: User Guide
userGuide.gettingStartedContent: This comprehensive guide will help you use the app effectively for skin lesion analysis.

howToUse.title: How to Use the App
howToUse.step1Content: Take or select a clear, well-lit photo of the skin lesion. Ensure the lesion fills the frame with some surrounding skin visible.
howToUse.step2Content: The AI will analyze the image and provide a comprehensive assessment including lesion classification, inflammatory conditions, and infectious disease detection.
howToUse.step3Content: Examine the diagnosis, confidence level, risk assessment, and treatment recommendations provided by the AI.
howToUse.step4Content: Always consult with a qualified dermatologist for confirmation and treatment planning.

photoTipsGuide.title: Photography Best Practices
photoTipsGuide.lighting: Lighting: Use natural daylight or bright, even artificial lighting. Avoid shadows and harsh direct light.
photoTipsGuide.focus: Focus: Ensure the camera is focused on the lesion. The image should be sharp and clear.
photoTipsGuide.distance: Distance: Keep the camera 6-12 inches (15-30 cm) from the lesion for optimal detail.
photoTipsGuide.framing: Framing: Fill the frame with the lesion while including some surrounding normal skin for context.
photoTipsGuide.angle: Angle: Hold the camera parallel to the skin surface, not at an angle.
photoTipsGuide.avoid: Avoid: Blurry images, poor lighting, extreme close-ups, and images taken through clothing.

understandingResults.title: Understanding Your Results
understandingResults.diagnosis: Primary Diagnosis: The most likely condition identified by the AI based on visual analysis.
understandingResults.confidence: Confidence Level: Indicates how certain the AI is about its prediction. Higher is more reliable.
understandingResults.riskLevel: Risk Assessment: Categorizes the lesion as high, moderate, or low risk based on potential health implications.
understandingResults.differential: Differential Diagnoses: Alternative possible diagnoses ranked by probability.
understandingResults.recommendations: Treatment Recommendations: Evidence-based suggestions for next steps and potential treatments.

features.title: Key Features
features.lesionClassification: Lesion Classification: Identifies various types of skin lesions including melanoma, carcinomas, and benign conditions.
features.inflammatory: Inflammatory Analysis: Detects common inflammatory skin conditions like eczema, psoriasis, and dermatitis.
features.infectious: Infectious Disease Detection: Identifies infectious conditions such as fungal infections, viral lesions, and bacterial infections.
features.tracking: Lesion Tracking: Monitor lesions over time and track changes in size, color, and appearance.
features.progressionTimeline: AI Progression Tracking: View a comprehensive timeline of all lesion changes, analyses, and AI-detected variations with automatic change detection and risk monitoring.
features.billingCoding: Automated Billing & Coding: Automatically generates CPT, ICD-10, and HCPCS codes for insurance billing with estimated reimbursement calculations and CMS-1500 form export.
features.populationHealth: Population Health Dashboard: View aggregated population-level health statistics, condition prevalence trends, risk distributions, and demographic insights across all users.
features.bodyMap: Body Map: Visualize and track the location of multiple lesions across your body.
features.history: Analysis History: Access previous analyses and track your skin health over time.
features.pdfReports: PDF Reports: Generate and share detailed analysis reports with healthcare providers.

safety.title: Important Safety Information
safety.notDiagnostic: This app is NOT a diagnostic tool. It provides educational information only.
safety.consultDoctor: Always consult a qualified dermatologist for any skin concerns or changes.
safety.emergency: Seek immediate medical attention if you notice rapid changes, bleeding, or severe symptoms.
safety.noTreatment: Do not start any treatment based solely on this app's recommendations.
safety.privacy: Your images and data are stored securely and are never shared without your permission.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Is this app a replacement for a doctor?
faq.a1: No. This app provides educational information and preliminary analysis. Always consult a qualified dermatologist for medical advice.
faq.q2: How accurate is the AI analysis?
faq.a2: The AI model has been trained on thousands of dermatological images and provides high accuracy. However, it should be used as a screening tool, not a definitive diagnosis.
faq.q3: What should I do if the app shows a high-risk result?
faq.a3: Schedule an appointment with a dermatologist as soon as possible. High-risk results require professional evaluation.
faq.q4: Can I use this app for children?
faq.a4: Yes, but always consult a pediatric dermatologist for children's skin conditions.
faq.q5: How do I take a good photo?
faq.a5: Use good lighting, keep the camera steady, focus on the lesion, and include some surrounding skin. See the Photography Best Practices section for details.

help.title: User Guide
help.subtitle: How to use the Skin Lesion Classifier App

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.content: Welcome to the Skin Lesion Classifier! This AI-powered app helps you analyze skin lesions and share results with dermatologists for professional review.

takingPhotos.title: Taking Quality Photos
takingPhotos.intro: For the best results, follow these guidelines:
takingPhotos.goodLightingText: Use natural daylight or bright, even indoor lighting. Avoid harsh shadows or dark conditions.
takingPhotos.focusText: Hold your camera steady and ensure the lesion is in sharp focus. Blurry images may be rejected.
takingPhotos.distanceText: Keep the camera 6-12 inches (15-30 cm) from the lesion. Fill most of the frame with the lesion while showing some surrounding skin.
takingPhotos.referenceObjectText: Place a coin (penny, quarter) or ruler next to the lesion to help the AI measure its size in millimeters.
takingPhotos.avoidFlashText: Camera flash can create glare and distort colors. Use natural or ambient lighting instead.

understandingAnalysis.title: Understanding Your Analysis
understandingAnalysis.step1Text: The app first validates your photo for resolution, focus, brightness, and contrast. If issues are detected, you'll see recommendations to improve the image quality.
understandingAnalysis.step2Text: The AI determines if your image contains a skin lesion or is a non-lesion image (normal skin, objects, etc.). Only lesion images proceed to detailed classification.
understandingAnalysis.step3Text: The system analyzes the lesion using advanced deep learning models and provides:
understandingAnalysis.step3Item2: Differential diagnoses (alternative possibilities ranked by probability)
understandingAnalysis.step3Item4: Red flag indicators (ABCDE criteria for serious conditions)
understandingAnalysis.step3Item5: Visual explanation showing which areas influenced the AI's decision

infectiousDisease.title: Infectious Disease Classification (NEW!)
infectiousDisease.intro: In addition to lesion analysis, the app now includes an AI model specifically trained to detect infectious skin conditions including bacterial, fungal, viral, and parasitic infections.
infectiousDisease.fungalList: Ringworm, Athlete's Foot, Jock Itch, Candidiasis, Tinea Versicolor
infectiousDisease.viralList: Herpes Simplex, Warts, Molluscum Contagiosum, Chickenpox
infectiousDisease.step1: On the home screen, select "Infectious Disease" as the analysis type
infectiousDisease.step2: Take or upload a clear photo of the affected area
infectiousDisease.step3: The AI will identify the infection type, severity, and contagiousness
infectiousDisease.step4: Review treatment recommendations and urgency level
infectiousDisease.urgency: Urgency level for seeking medical care
infectiousDisease.note1: Always consult a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and prescription treatment
infectiousDisease.note2: If condition is contagious, follow hygiene protocols to prevent spread
infectiousDisease.note3: Seek immediate care for severe symptoms or rapid worsening

resultsInterpretation.title: What the Results Mean
resultsInterpretation.highConfidenceText: AI is very confident in its prediction
resultsInterpretation.moderateConfidenceText: AI has good confidence but recommends dermatologist review
resultsInterpretation.lowConfidenceText: AI is uncertain - professional evaluation strongly recommended
resultsInterpretation.lowRiskText: Monitor and consult if changes occur

aiExplainability.title: AI Explainability Heatmap (NEW!)
aiExplainability.intro: See exactly which parts of your skin lesion influenced the AI's decision with our advanced explainability visualization.
aiExplainability.whatIsItText: The explainability heatmap is a color-coded overlay on your analyzed image that shows which areas the AI focused on when making its diagnosis. Red/orange areas indicate regions that most strongly influenced the prediction, while blue/green areas had less impact.
aiExplainability.redOrangeText: High importance - these features strongly influenced the diagnosis
aiExplainability.yellowText: Moderate importance - contributing factors to the decision
aiExplainability.blueGreenText: Lower importance - less critical to the diagnosis
aiExplainability.matter1: Builds trust by showing you how the AI makes decisions
aiExplainability.matter2: Helps identify specific features that may need attention
aiExplainability.matter3: Validates the AI is looking at the right areas
aiExplainability.matter4: Useful for discussing results with your dermatologist

plainEnglish.title: Plain English Explanation (NEW!)
plainEnglish.intro: Every diagnosis comes with a simple, easy-to-understand explanation in plain language - no medical jargon!
plainEnglish.whatYouGetText: After each analysis, you'll see a "What Does This Mean?" section that explains your condition in everyday language. Instead of confusing medical terminology, you'll get a friendly, conversational explanation that helps you understand:
plainEnglish.item1: What the condition actually is (in simple terms)
plainEnglish.item4: What steps you should take next
plainEnglish.textToSpeechText: Tap the "Listen" button to have the explanation read aloud to you! This is perfect for:
plainEnglish.tts3: Better understanding through both reading and hearing

clinicalDecision.title: Clinical Decision Support System (NEW!)
clinicalDecision.intro: Get comprehensive, evidence-based treatment protocols and clinical recommendations for every diagnosis. This professional-grade feature provides the same information doctors use to make treatment decisions.
clinicalDecision.treatmentProtocolText: Step-by-step treatment recommendations with timeframes and rationale
clinicalDecision.medicationInfoText: Complete details on 50+ medications including dosing, costs, insurance coverage, side effects, and contraindications
clinicalDecision.insuranceText: ICD-10 and CPT codes, plus pre-authorization requirements
clinicalDecision.patientEducationText: Key points to help you understand your condition and treatment
clinicalDecision.evidenceBasedText: All recommendations are based on the latest clinical guidelines from:
clinicalDecision.importantNoteText: This is clinical DECISION SUPPORT, not decision-making. All recommendations should be reviewed with your licensed healthcare provider. This tool helps inform discussions with your doctor but does not replace professional medical judgment.

findSpecialists.title: Find Nearby Specialists (NEW!)
findSpecialists.intro: After each diagnosis, the app recommends which medical specialists you should see and helps you find them in your area.
findSpecialists.step1: After analysis, scroll to the "Recommended Specialists" section
findSpecialists.step3: Tap any specialist card to find nearby doctors in that specialty
findSpecialists.step4: View up to 5 nearby doctors with ratings, distance, and contact info
findSpecialists.step5: Call directly or get directions with one tap
findSpecialists.specialistTypesText: Depending on your diagnosis, the app may recommend:
findSpecialists.locationPermissionsText: To find nearby doctors, the app needs access to your location. You can enable this when prompted or in your device settings. Your location is only used to search for nearby healthcare providers and is never stored or shared.

realTimeProgress.title: Real-Time Analysis Progress (NEW!)
realTimeProgress.intro: Watch your analysis progress in real-time with smooth percentage tracking!
realTimeProgress.whatYouSeeText: When you tap "Run Analysis," the button will show live progress updates:
realTimeProgress.conclusion: The progress bar and percentage update smoothly so you always know how much time is left. Most analyses complete in under 2 minutes!

insurancePreAuth.title: Insurance Pre-Authorization AI (NEW!)
insurancePreAuth.intro: Our AI automatically generates comprehensive insurance pre-authorization documentation for every analysis, making it easier to get coverage for recommended procedures and treatments.
insurancePreAuth.medicalNecessityText: A formal letter explaining why the recommended procedures are medically necessary, with evidence-based justification
insurancePreAuth.preAuthFormText: Structured information ready to fill out insurance pre-auth forms including:
insurancePreAuth.clinicalSummaryText: Comprehensive clinical summary including findings, assessment, plan, and prognosis
insurancePreAuth.supportingEvidenceText: References to clinical guidelines (AAD, NCCN), treatment efficacy data, and diagnostic accuracy information
insurancePreAuth.recommendedProceduresText: For each diagnosis, the AI recommends appropriate procedures with CPT codes and medical rationale:
insurancePreAuth.dermoscopyText: For all conditions to document lesion characteristics
insurancePreAuth.biopsyText: For suspicious or malignant lesions requiring tissue diagnosis
insurancePreAuth.excisionText: For confirmed malignancies with appropriate margin specifications
insurancePreAuth.phototherapyText: For chronic inflammatory conditions like psoriasis
insurancePreAuth.destructionText: For premalignant lesions like actinic keratosis
insurancePreAuth.authorizationSummaryText: The pre-authorization section displays a quick summary showing:
insurancePreAuth.exportPDFText: Generate a professional document with all pre-authorization information, clinical images, and supporting documentation. The PDF is immediately available for download and sharing.
insurancePreAuth.shareDocText: Send the pre-authorization package via email to your healthcare provider or insurance company
insurancePreAuth.viewFullDocsText: Tap any preview to read the complete medical necessity letter or clinical summary
insurancePreAuth.howToUseStep1: Run your analysis as normal - pre-authorization documentation is generated automatically
insurancePreAuth.howToUseStep2: Scroll down to the "Insurance Pre-Authorization" section in your analysis report
insurancePreAuth.howToUseStep3: Review the authorization summary and recommended procedures
insurancePreAuth.howToUseStep4: Tap "View Full Letter" or "View Full Summary" to read complete documents
insurancePreAuth.howToUseStep5: Tap "Export as PDF" to download a complete document with all information, or use "Share Documentation" to copy text or export PDF
insurancePreAuth.howToUseStep6: Have your physician review and sign the documents before submitting to insurance
insurancePreAuth.clinicalGuidelinesText: All pre-authorization recommendations are based on evidence-based clinical guidelines:
insurancePreAuth.guidelineAAD: American Academy of Dermatology (AAD) Clinical Guidelines
insurancePreAuth.guidelineAADA: American Academy of Dermatology Association (AADA) Guidelines
insurancePreAuth.fasterApprovalsText: Comprehensive documentation streamlines the insurance review process
insurancePreAuth.betterCoverageText: Evidence-based justification increases likelihood of authorization
insurancePreAuth.savesTimeText: Eliminates hours of paperwork for you and your healthcare provider
insurancePreAuth.reducesDenialsText: Complete documentation with codes and guidelines reduces denial rates
insurancePreAuth.professionalQualityText: Documentation meets medical and insurance industry standards
insurancePreAuth.approvalLikelihoodText: The AI predicts your chances of insurance approval based on multiple factors:
insurancePreAuth.diagnosticConfidenceFactorText: Higher AI confidence increases approval likelihood
insurancePreAuth.clinicalUrgencyText: Urgent cases have higher approval rates
insurancePreAuth.approvalScore: You'll see a percentage score (0-100%), category (HIGHLY LIKELY, LIKELY, MODERATE, UNCERTAIN), and personalized recommendations to improve your submission.
insurancePreAuth.statusTrackingText: Track your pre-authorization through the entire approval process:
insurancePreAuth.statusDraftText: Documentation generated but not submitted yet
insurancePreAuth.statusSubmittedText: Sent to insurance company (submission date recorded)
insurancePreAuth.statusUnderReviewText: Insurance company is evaluating your request
insurancePreAuth.statusDeniedText: Request rejected (can resubmit with additional info)
insurancePreAuth.updateStatus: Tap "Update Status" to change the current status as your submission progresses through the approval pipeline.
insurancePreAuth.autoFillFormsText: Pre-filled insurance forms ready for submission:
insurancePreAuth.cms1500Text: Standard professional claim form with all diagnosis codes, CPT codes, and clinical rationale pre-filled
insurancePreAuth.ub04Text: Hospital/facility billing form with revenue codes and diagnosis information
insurancePreAuth.genericPreAuthText: Universal form that works with most insurance providers
insurancePreAuth.autoFillNote: Fields marked with [BRACKETS] require your specific patient/provider information. All clinical data, codes, and justifications are automatically filled in. Include the medical necessity letter and clinical images when submitting.
insurancePreAuth.importantNote1: This documentation is AI-generated and should be reviewed and signed by a licensed physician before submission
insurancePreAuth.importantNote2: Pre-authorization does not guarantee insurance approval - final decisions are made by your insurance provider
insurancePreAuth.importantNote3: Your physician may modify recommendations based on your complete medical history and examination
insurancePreAuth.importantNote4: This feature streamlines documentation but does not replace professional medical judgment
insurancePreAuth.importantNote5: Insurance coverage policies vary - check with your specific insurance provider for their requirements

progressionTimeline.title: AI Progression Tracking + Timeline (NEW!)
progressionTimeline.intro: Track all your lesion changes over time in one comprehensive, visual timeline powered by AI-automated change detection.
progressionTimeline.whatIsItText: The AI Progression Tracking feature aggregates all events related to your tracked lesions into a single, chronological timeline. This includes new analyses, AI-detected changes, risk increases, and important alerts.
progressionTimeline.howToAccessText: From the main menu, tap "AI Progression Tracking" (ðŸ“Š) to view your comprehensive timeline.
progressionTimeline.statisticsOverviewText: At the top, see quick stats including total tracked lesions, total analyses, changes detected, and lesions needing attention.
progressionTimeline.filterOptionsText: Filter events by type (All Events, Changes, Alerts, Analyses) and time range (30 days, 90 days, 6 months, 1 year).
progressionTimeline.timelineEventsText: Each event displays with color-coded icons showing the lesion name, location, date, and detailed information about what changed.
progressionTimeline.lesionCreatedText: When you start tracking a new lesion
progressionTimeline.newAnalysisText: Each time you add a photo and analysis to a tracked lesion
progressionTimeline.changeDetectedText: When AI comparison finds significant changes in size, color, or shape between analyses
progressionTimeline.riskIncreaseText: When the risk level increases from lowâ†’medium or mediumâ†’high
progressionTimeline.alertsText: Important notifications for concerning changes or overdue check-ups
progressionTimeline.automaticChangeDetectionText: The AI automatically compares new analyses with previous ones for the same lesion, detecting:
progressionTimeline.viewDetails: Tap any event to view full details about that analysis or navigate to the lesion's detail page.
progressionTimeline.earlyDetectionText: Automated change tracking helps catch concerning changes before they become serious
progressionTimeline.comprehensiveViewText: See all your lesion data in one place instead of checking each lesion individually
progressionTimeline.trendAnalysisText: Identify patterns and trends across all your tracked lesions over time
progressionTimeline.doctorReportsText: Share your progression timeline with dermatologists for informed decision-making

billingCoding.title: Automated Billing & Coding (NEW!)
billingCoding.intro: Automatically generate medical billing codes (CPT, ICD-10, HCPCS) for insurance claims with estimated costs and reimbursement calculations.
billingCoding.whatIsItText: Every analysis automatically generates appropriate medical billing codes based on your diagnosis, risk level, and recommended procedures. This streamlines insurance billing and helps you understand expected costs.
billingCoding.howToAccessText: From the main menu, tap "Automated Billing & Coding" (ðŸ’³) to view all your billing records.
billingCoding.automaticGenerationText: The system automatically generates codes based on:
billingCoding.diagnosisMappingText: Each skin condition is mapped to the appropriate ICD-10 diagnosis code (e.g., C43.9 for melanoma, L70.0 for acne)
billingCoding.procedureRecommendationsText: High-risk lesions automatically include biopsy codes (CPT 11102), all analyses include photography codes (CPT 96904)
billingCoding.reimbursementEstimatesText: Based on Medicare rates and typical insurance reimbursement (80% of charges)
billingCoding.cptCodesText: Procedure codes with descriptions (e.g., 96904 - Clinical photography, 11102 - Biopsy)
billingCoding.financialSummaryText: Total charges and estimated insurance reimbursement
billingCoding.codeLookupText: Search the medical coding database to find:
billingCoding.cms1500ExportText: Generate standard insurance claim forms (CMS-1500) with all codes pre-filled
billingCoding.pdfGenerationText: Create professional billing documents for submission to insurance companies
billingCoding.filterByStatusText: View records by status (All, Draft, Submitted, Approved, Rejected) to track your billing submissions.
billingCoding.note1: Billing codes are AI-generated estimates based on standard medical coding practices
billingCoding.note2: Actual codes and charges should be verified by your healthcare provider
billingCoding.note3: Insurance coverage and reimbursement rates vary by plan and provider
billingCoding.note4: These codes are for informational purposes and should be reviewed by billing professionals
billingCoding.note5: Always consult with your dermatologist's billing department for actual claim submission

populationHealth.title: Population Health Dashboard (NEW!)
populationHealth.intro: View aggregated, anonymized population-level health statistics to understand broader skin health trends, condition prevalence, and demographic patterns.
populationHealth.whatIsItText: The Population Health Dashboard provides epidemiological insights by aggregating data across all users (anonymized). This helps identify trends, high-risk populations, and common conditions for public health awareness.
populationHealth.howToAccessText: From the main menu, tap "Population Health Dashboard" (ðŸ“Š) to view population-level analytics.
populationHealth.overviewStatisticsText: Get a bird's-eye view of the population health data:
populationHealth.totalAnalysesMetricText: Total number of skin lesion analyses performed across all users
populationHealth.totalUsersMetricText: Number of active users in the system
populationHealth.highRiskCasesText: Count of analyses flagged as high or very high risk
populationHealth.averageAgeText: Mean age of users with analyses in the selected time period
populationHealth.conditionPrevalenceText: See which skin conditions are most common in the population:
populationHealth.percentageOfTotal: Percentage of total analyses for each condition
populationHealth.trendIndicators: Trend indicators (â†‘ trending up, â†“ trending down, â†’ stable)
populationHealth.comparedToPrevious: Trends compared to previous time period to identify emerging patterns
populationHealth.riskDistributionText: Understand the distribution of risk levels across the population:
populationHealth.veryHighRisk: Very high risk cases (percentage and count)
populationHealth.geographicInsightsText: View regional patterns in skin health (simulated data for demo):
populationHealth.regionalBreakdown: Regional breakdown (Northeast, Southeast, Midwest, Southwest, West)
populationHealth.highRiskPercentage: High-risk percentage for each region to identify geographic hotspots
populationHealth.demographicInsightsText: Analyze skin health patterns across different age groups:
populationHealth.commonConditionsPerGroup: Most common conditions for each demographic
populationHealth.genderDistributionText: Visualize the gender breakdown of users with horizontal bar charts showing percentages for Male, Female, and Other/Unspecified.
populationHealth.timeRangeFilteringText: Adjust the time period to analyze trends:
populationHealth.publicHealthText: Identify which conditions are becoming more prevalent
populationHealth.resourceAllocationText: Understand where to focus educational efforts and screening programs
populationHealth.epidemiologyText: Track seasonal variations and demographic patterns in skin conditions
populationHealth.healthEquityText: Identify underserved populations or regions with higher risk levels
populationHealth.note1: All data is aggregated and anonymized to protect individual privacy
populationHealth.note2: Geographic insights are simulated for demonstration purposes
populationHealth.note3: In a production system, this dashboard would typically be admin-only
populationHealth.note4: Trends are calculated by comparing current period to equivalent previous period
populationHealth.note5: This tool is for educational and research purposes, not for individual diagnosis

historyManagement.title: Managing Your Analysis History
historyManagement.intro: Access your complete analysis history by tapping the "ðŸ“Š History" button on the home screen.
historyManagement.viewPastAnalyses: View all past analyses with images and diagnoses
historyManagement.trackChanges: Track how lesions change over time
historyManagement.markLocations: Mark lesion locations on an interactive body map
historyManagement.documentMedications: Document medications that may affect your skin
historyManagement.addBiopsyResults: Add biopsy results to compare AI predictions with actual pathology

sharingDermatologist.title: Sharing with Your Dermatologist
sharingDermatologist.intro: The app includes a secure teledermatology feature to share your results with a dermatologist:
sharingDermatologist.step1: Open any analysis from your history and tap "ðŸ“¤ Share with Dermatologist"
sharingDermatologist.step2: Enter your dermatologist's name and email address
sharingDermatologist.step3: Add an optional message with specific questions or concerns
sharingDermatologist.step4: Tap "Share Analysis" - a secure link will be copied to your clipboard
sharingDermatologist.step5: Choose "Send via Email" to automatically open your email app with the link, or manually share the link via text, messaging apps, or other methods
sharingDermatologist.professionalWebPage: Professional web page with your analysis details
sharingDermatologist.downloadablePDF: Downloadable PDF report for their medical records
sharingDermatologist.skinLesionImage: Your skin lesion image with AI diagnosis and confidence levels
sharingDermatologist.clinicalInfo: All clinical information: symptoms, medications, medical history, risk factors
sharingDermatologist.yourMessage: Your message with questions or concerns
sharingDermatologist.dermatologistReviewText: After reviewing your analysis, your dermatologist can add their professional notes and recommendations directly in the system. You'll see a "Reviewed" badge and can read their feedback when you view the analysis in your history.

bodyMap.title: Body Map Feature
bodyMap.intro: Before each analysis, you'll be prompted to mark where the lesion is located on your body:
bodyMap.selectRegion: Select the body region (head, chest, arm, leg, etc.)
bodyMap.chooseSide: Choose left or right side if applicable
bodyMap.trackMultiple: This helps track multiple lesions and monitor changes over time

lesionTracking.title: Lesion Tracking & Change Detection
lesionTracking.intro: Track individual lesions over time with AI-powered change detection to monitor for concerning developments:
lesionTracking.step1: Go to your analysis history and tap the "ðŸ” Track" button on any lesion analysis
lesionTracking.step2: Give the lesion a memorable name (e.g., "Mole on left shoulder")
lesionTracking.step3: Set monitoring frequency (weekly, monthly, quarterly, biannual, or annual)
lesionTracking.step4: The app will remind you when it's time to take a follow-up photo
lesionTracking.sizeChangesText: Growth rate in mmÂ²/month with calibrated measurements
lesionTracking.colorChangesText: Darkening, lightening, or new color variations
lesionTracking.symptomChangesText: New or worsening itching, pain, or bleeding
lesionTracking.abcdeCriteriaText: Track evolution of melanoma warning signs
lesionTracking.viewingTrackedLesionsText: Tap "ðŸ” Track" on the home screen to view all tracked lesions. You'll see:
lesionTracking.completeTimeline: Complete timeline of all analyses for each lesion
lesionTracking.growthCharts: Growth charts showing size over time
lesionTracking.alertBadges: Alert badges for lesions requiring attention
lesionTracking.clinicalRecommendations: Clinical recommendations based on detected changes
lesionTracking.whenToSeekText: The AI will alert you if it detects concerning changes such as:

familyHistory.title: Family History & Genetic Risk Assessment
familyHistory.intro: Track your family's skin cancer history to assess your genetic risk and receive personalized screening recommendations:
familyHistory.step1: Tap "ðŸ§¬ Family" from the home screen or hamburger menu
familyHistory.step2: Add family members with their relationship (parent, sibling, grandparent, etc.)
familyHistory.step3: Document any skin cancer diagnoses (melanoma, basal cell, squamous cell)
familyHistory.step4: Include age at diagnosis and outcome for comprehensive risk assessment
familyHistory.familyHistoryPatternsText: Number of affected relatives and their relationship to you
familyHistory.multiplePrimaryMelanomasText: Family members with more than one melanoma diagnosis
familyHistory.earlyOnsetMelanomaText: Diagnoses before age 50 indicating genetic predisposition
familyHistory.pancreaticCancerLinkText: Family history of both melanoma and pancreatic cancer (FAMMM syndrome)
familyHistory.personalRiskFactorsText: Number of moles, skin type, sun exposure, history of sunburns
familyHistory.lowRiskText: No family history, standard screening recommended
familyHistory.moderateRiskText: Some family history, annual dermatologist visits recommended
familyHistory.highRiskText: Strong family history, genetic testing and frequent monitoring recommended

geneticTesting.title: Genetic Testing Integration
geneticTesting.intro: Upload and track genetic testing results to refine your melanoma risk assessment:
geneticTesting.cdkn2aText: Primary genetic risk factor for familial melanoma
geneticTesting.bap1Text: Linked to uveal melanoma and other cancers
geneticTesting.mc1rText: Associated with red hair, fair skin, and melanoma risk
geneticTesting.mitfText: Rare but high-penetrance melanoma susceptibility genes
geneticTesting.howToAdd: How to Add Genetic Test Results:
geneticTesting.addStep1: Navigate to Family History page and tap "Genetic Testing"
geneticTesting.addStep2: Upload your genetic test report (PDF or image from 23andMe, Color, Invitae, etc.)
geneticTesting.addStep3: Select the gene tested and enter your result (Positive, Negative, VUS)
geneticTesting.addStep4: System automatically adjusts your melanoma risk score based on genetic findings
geneticTesting.multiplePrimary: Multiple primary melanomas in one family member
geneticTesting.familyPancreatic: Family history of melanoma and pancreatic cancer
geneticTesting.positiveResult: Positive genetic test result (pathogenic variant found)

smartAlerts.title: Smart Alert System
smartAlerts.intro: Receive intelligent notifications to stay on top of your skin health monitoring:
smartAlerts.followUpRemindersText: Scheduled notifications for tracked lesion monitoring
smartAlerts.changeDetectionText: Automatic warnings when AI detects concerning changes
smartAlerts.highRiskFindingsText: Immediate notifications for high-risk analysis results
smartAlerts.screeningRemindersText: Personalized notifications for self-exams and dermatologist visits
smartAlerts.geneticCounselingText: Alerts when family history warrants genetic consultation
smartAlerts.criticalText: High-risk findings or rapid lesion changes - seek immediate medical attention
smartAlerts.importantText: Moderate changes or upcoming dermatologist appointments
smartAlerts.routineText: Regular monitoring reminders and self-exam schedules

predictiveAnalytics.title: Predictive Analytics Dashboard
predictiveAnalytics.intro: Leverage AI-powered forecasting to anticipate lesion changes and optimize your monitoring schedule:
predictiveAnalytics.growthIntro: The AI analyzes historical data from your tracked lesions to predict future changes:
predictiveAnalytics.sizePredictionsText: Forecasted size at 30, 60, and 90 days based on growth rate
predictiveAnalytics.growthTrendText: Classification as stable, slow growth, moderate growth, or rapid growth
predictiveAnalytics.riskEscalationText: Likelihood of risk level increasing (e.g., low to medium)
predictiveAnalytics.confidenceScoringText: How reliable the forecast is based on data quality and history length
predictiveAnalytics.changeVelocityText: Rate of change in size, color, and shape characteristics
predictiveAnalytics.scheduleIntro: Based on your risk profile, genetic history, and lesion forecasts, the system generates a customized monitoring plan:
predictiveAnalytics.selfExamText: Monthly, quarterly, or annual full-body skin checks
predictiveAnalytics.dermaVisitText: Recommended intervals based on risk level (quarterly, biannual, annual)
predictiveAnalytics.individualLesionText: Custom monitoring frequency for each tracked lesion
predictiveAnalytics.geneticApptText: Scheduled if family history meets clinical criteria
predictiveAnalytics.oneTapCompleteText: Mark appointments complete and automatically schedule next occurrence
predictiveAnalytics.riskTrendIntro: Track how your overall skin cancer risk evolves over time with interactive charts:
predictiveAnalytics.overallScoreText: Composite score combining genetic, environmental, and lesion factors
predictiveAnalytics.melanomaSpecificText: Focused assessment for most serious skin cancer type
predictiveAnalytics.historicalSnapshotsText: Monthly risk scores showing improvement or deterioration
predictiveAnalytics.contributingFactorsText: Breakdown of what's driving your risk (genetics, lesion count, changes, etc.)
predictiveAnalytics.accessStep1: Tap "ðŸ“Š Analytics" from the home screen or hamburger menu
predictiveAnalytics.accessStep2: View three tabs: Forecasts, Schedule, and Trends
predictiveAnalytics.accessStep3: Forecasts tab shows predictions for all tracked lesions with color-coded severity
predictiveAnalytics.accessStep4: Schedule tab displays your personalized screening calendar with overdue highlighting
predictiveAnalytics.accessStep5: Trends tab visualizes your risk trajectory over the past 6-12 months
predictiveAnalytics.highConfidenceText: 4+ analyses over 3+ months with consistent patterns
predictiveAnalytics.importantNoteText: Predictive analytics are statistical estimates based on your data. Always consult a dermatologist for medical decisions, especially if forecasts indicate concerning trends.

sunExposure.title: Sun Exposure & UV Tracking
sunExposure.intro: Track your sun exposure to understand your UV risk and correlate it with lesion development:
sunExposure.understandRiskText: UV radiation is the primary preventable cause of skin cancer
sunExposure.correlateLesionsText: Identify if sun exposure patterns contributed to lesion development
sunExposure.improveHabitsText: See your protection compliance rate and get personalized recommendations
sunExposure.preventDamageText: Make informed decisions about sun protection
sunExposure.logStep1: Tap "â˜€ï¸ Sun Exposure" from the hamburger menu
sunExposure.logStep2: On the "Log Exposure" tab, enter when and where you were in the sun
sunExposure.logStep3: Record the duration (in minutes), time of day, location, and activity
sunExposure.logStep4: Enter the UV index if known (check weather apps or UV index websites)
sunExposure.logStep5: Record what sun protection you used: sunscreen (with SPF level), hat, protective clothing, etc.
sunExposure.logStep6: Select which body areas were exposed to the sun
sunExposure.logStep7: Note any skin reaction (redness, burn, tanning) and severity
sunExposure.logStep8: Tap "Log Sun Exposure" - the app calculates your UV dose and risk score
sunExposure.lowText: Minimal risk, no protection needed for most people
sunExposure.veryHighText: Very high risk, extra protection needed
sunExposure.historyIntro: The "History" tab shows all your logged sun exposures with:
sunExposure.dateAndDuration: Date, duration, and UV index for each exposure
sunExposure.uvDose: Calculated UV dose and risk score (0-100)
sunExposure.totalExposuresText: How much time you spent in the sun
sunExposure.sunburnEventsText: Number of times you got sunburned
sunExposure.protectionRateText: Percentage of exposures where you used sun protection
sunExposure.highRiskExposuresText: Number of exposures with risk score above 70
sunExposure.personalizedRecsText: Tips to improve your sun protection habits
sunExposure.correlationIntro: The app automatically analyzes if your sun exposure patterns contributed to tracked lesions:
sunExposure.correlationScoreText: Statistical measure (0-100%) of how strongly sun exposure correlates with the lesion
sunExposure.riskFactorsIdText: Specific behaviors that increased risk (e.g., sunburns, high UV exposure, poor protection)
sunExposure.protectiveFactorsText: Good habits you maintained (e.g., adequate SPF, no sunburns)
sunExposure.preventionRecsText: Specific advice to reduce future risk
sunExposure.screeningUrgencyText: Whether the correlation warrants immediate medical attention
sunExposure.strongPositiveText: High likelihood that sun exposure contributed to lesion development
sunExposure.moderatePositiveText: Moderate correlation, sun exposure may have played a role
sunExposure.weakNoneText: Low or no statistical correlation detected
sunExposure.seekShade: Seek shade during peak UV hours
sunExposure.wearClothingText: Long sleeves, pants, wide-brimmed hat, UV-blocking sunglasses
sunExposure.beCareful: Be extra careful at high altitude
sunExposure.strongCorrelation: Strong correlation between sun exposure and lesion development
sunExposure.newChanging: New or changing lesions on sun-exposed areas (face, arms, back)
sunExposure.concernsFooter: If any of these apply, schedule a dermatologist appointment for a full skin examination.

treatmentMonitoring.title: Treatment Monitoring
treatmentMonitoring.whyTrackIntro: Treatment monitoring helps you and your healthcare provider understand how well medications and procedures are working:
treatmentMonitoring.trackObjective: Track objective changes in lesion size, color, and inflammation
treatmentMonitoring.monitorAdherence: Monitor medication adherence and identify missed doses
treatmentMonitoring.documentSideEffects: Document side effects and reactions for medical review
treatmentMonitoring.compareBeforeAfter: Compare before/after results to determine if adjustments are needed
treatmentMonitoring.provideRecords: Provide detailed records for dermatologist appointments
treatmentMonitoring.createIntro: To start tracking a new treatment:
treatmentMonitoring.createStep1: Navigate to Treatment Monitoring from the menu
treatmentMonitoring.createStep4: Select treatment type: topical, oral medication, injection, or procedure
treatmentMonitoring.createStep5: Add active ingredient, dosage (e.g., "1%", "500mg"), and frequency
treatmentMonitoring.createStep6: Specify what condition is being treated (indication)
treatmentMonitoring.createStep7: Set start date and any treatment goals
treatmentMonitoring.topicalText: Creams, ointments, gels applied to skin
treatmentMonitoring.injectionText: Shots, biologics administered by healthcare provider
treatmentMonitoring.logStep1: Go to "Log & Track" tab and ensure "Log Dose" mode is selected
treatmentMonitoring.logStep2: Select the treatment from the dropdown
treatmentMonitoring.logStep3: Record date and time of application/dose
treatmentMonitoring.logStep4: Indicate if taken as prescribed or if dose was missed
treatmentMonitoring.logStep5: Note any immediate reactions (redness, burning, itching)
treatmentMonitoring.loggingTipText: Log doses consistently to accurately calculate adherence rates.
treatmentMonitoring.effectStep1: In "Log & Track" tab, switch to "Effectiveness Assessment" mode
treatmentMonitoring.effectStep3: Enter baseline measurements (size, color, inflammation before treatment)
treatmentMonitoring.effectStep4: Enter current measurements (how lesion looks now)
treatmentMonitoring.effectStep5: Rate effectiveness from 1-5 stars based on your perception
treatmentMonitoring.effectStep6: Check improvements noted: size reduced, less red, less itchy, flatter
treatmentMonitoring.effectStep7: Check any side effects: redness, irritation, dryness, burning
treatmentMonitoring.scoresIntro: The app calculates an objective effectiveness score (0-100) based on measurable changes:
treatmentMonitoring.score75100Text: Highly effective - significant improvement in size, color, inflammation
treatmentMonitoring.score5074Text: Moderately effective - noticeable improvement, treatment working
treatmentMonitoring.score2549Text: Minimally effective - slight improvement, may need adjustment
treatmentMonitoring.score024Text: Not effective - little to no improvement, discuss alternatives
treatmentMonitoring.sizeChangeText: Smaller lesions indicate improvement (up to 50 points)
treatmentMonitoring.colorChangeText: Lighter pigmentation suggests healing (up to 20 points)
treatmentMonitoring.inflammationText: Reduced swelling and redness (up to 20 points)
treatmentMonitoring.symptomsText: Less itching, pain, or bleeding (up to 10 points)
treatmentMonitoring.adherenceIntro: Adherence rate shows how consistently you're following the treatment plan:
treatmentMonitoring.adher5069Text: Fair adherence - frequent missed doses may affect results
treatmentMonitoring.adherBelow50Text: Poor adherence - treatment unlikely to be effective
treatmentMonitoring.adherenceTipText: Set phone reminders for dose times to improve adherence. Low adherence may explain why a treatment isn't working.
treatmentMonitoring.scoreBelow25: Effectiveness score below 25 after 4-6 weeks of consistent use
treatmentMonitoring.increasingSize: Lesion increasing in size despite treatment
treatmentMonitoring.severeSide: Severe side effects interfering with adherence
treatmentMonitoring.adjustFooter: Never adjust prescription treatments without consulting your healthcare provider.
treatmentMonitoring.docBaselineText: Take measurements and photos before starting treatment
treatmentMonitoring.logConsistentText: Record every dose/application to track adherence accurately
treatmentMonitoring.sameConditionsText: Measure at similar times/lighting for consistency
treatmentMonitoring.noteReactionsText: Document both improvements and side effects
treatmentMonitoring.bePatientText: Most treatments require 4-8 weeks to show results
treatmentMonitoring.shareProviderText: Bring treatment logs to dermatology appointments

dermatologistIntegration.title: Dermatologist Integration
dermatologistIntegration.videoConsults: Live video consultations for real-time assessment
dermatologistIntegration.secondOpinions: Expert second opinions on diagnoses and treatment plans
dermatologistIntegration.accessDirectory: Access to dermatologist directory with specializations
dermatologistIntegration.findIntro: Use the Directory tab to search for dermatologists:

dermatologistIntegration.findStep2: Use search filters: city, state, or specialization
dermatologistIntegration.findStep4: Review profiles showing credentials, practice info, and specializations
dermatologistIntegration.findStep5: Tap any dermatologist card to select and see available services

dermatologistIntegration.joinCall: Tap "ðŸŽ¥ Join Video Call" when it's time
dermatologistIntegration.dermaAdds: Dermatologist adds diagnosis and treatment plan after session
dermatologistIntegration.referralsIntro: Submit formal referrals for specialized dermatology care:
dermatologistIntegration.refStep3: Select referral reason: Suspicious Lesion, Screening, or Treatment Resistant
dermatologistIntegration.refStep4: Describe your primary concern in detail
dermatologistIntegration.refStep5: Choose urgency level: Routine, Semi-Urgent, or Urgent
dermatologistIntegration.refStep6: Add referring provider name if applicable
dermatologistIntegration.secondOpinionIntro: Get expert review of existing diagnoses or treatment plans:
dermatologistIntegration.opinionStep4: Select reason: Uncertainty, High Risk, or Peace of Mind
dermatologistIntegration.aggressiveTreatment: Aggressive or complex treatment plan proposed
dermatologistIntegration.peaceOfMind: Personal peace of mind before major decision
dermatologistIntegration.routineUrgencyText: Standard wait times (2-4 weeks), non-urgent concerns
dermatologistIntegration.urgentText: Priority handling (1-2 days), rapidly changing lesions, severe symptoms
dermatologistIntegration.emergencyNoteText: For medical emergencies, call 911 or visit the emergency room immediately. This system is not for acute emergencies.
dermatologistIntegration.pediatricText: Skin conditions in children and adolescents
dermatologistIntegration.skinCancerText: Diagnosis and treatment of skin cancers
dermatologistIntegration.goodLightingText: Ensure area is well-lit for clear visibility
dermatologistIntegration.quietSpaceText: Find private location with minimal background noise
dermatologistIntegration.cameraReadyText: Practice showing lesion area to camera
dermatologistIntegration.documentsReadyText: Have medical history and medication list available
dermatologistIntegration.joinEarlyText: Log in 5 minutes before scheduled time
dermatologistIntegration.protectedRecords: Protected health records accessible only to authorized providers

aiChatAssistant.title: AI Chat Assistant (NEW!)
aiChatAssistant.intro: Get instant, AI-powered explanations about your skin conditions using advanced GPT-4 technology.

learnMore.title: Learn More Feature
learnMore.text: After each diagnosis, tap the "Learn More" button to get a detailed, conversational explanation.
learnMore.conditionExplanation: A clear explanation of the diagnosed condition in plain language
learnMore.symptomsOverview: Common symptoms and what to watch for
learnMore.treatmentOptions: General treatment options and next steps
learnMore.whenToSeekCare: When to seek professional medical care

differentialReasoning.title: Differential Reasoning
differentialReasoning.text: The AI provides chain-of-thought diagnostic reasoning, showing you:
differentialReasoning.primaryDiagnosis: Why the primary diagnosis was chosen
differentialReasoning.keyFeatures: Key features that influenced the decision
differentialReasoning.confidenceExplanation: Why the confidence level is what it is

howToUse.title: How to Use
howToUse.step2: Scroll to the diagnosis section in your results
howToUse.step3: Tap the "Learn More" or "Ask AI" button
howToUse.step4: Wait a few seconds for the AI to generate a response
howToUse.step5: Read the detailed explanation or ask follow-up questions

importantNotes.title: Important Notes
importantNotes.note1: AI explanations are for educational purposes only
importantNotes.note2: Always consult a healthcare provider for medical advice
importantNotes.note3: The AI uses the latest medical knowledge but is not a replacement for professional diagnosis
importantNotes.note4: Response times may vary based on server load

dataAugmentation.title: Data Augmentation (NEW!)
dataAugmentation.intro: Generate synthetic training data to improve AI model accuracy, especially for rare skin conditions.
dataAugmentation.professionalFeatureText: This feature is available to dermatologists and healthcare professionals for research and model improvement purposes.

augmentationTypes.title: Augmentation Types
augmentationTypes.geometricText: Rotation, scaling, flipping, and perspective transformations
augmentationTypes.colorText: Brightness, contrast, saturation, and hue adjustments
augmentationTypes.noiseText: Gaussian noise, blur, and compression artifacts
augmentationTypes.advancedText: Elastic deformation, grid distortion, and optical distortion
augmentationTypes.dermatologyText: Skin tone variation, lighting simulation, and hair artifact addition
augmentationTypes.mixupText: Combine multiple images for advanced data augmentation

howToUse.title: How to Use
howToUse.step1: Navigate to Data Augmentation from the menu
howToUse.step2: Upload a source skin lesion image
howToUse.step3: Select the augmentation types you want to apply
howToUse.step4: Choose the number of augmented images to generate
howToUse.step5: Preview or download the augmented images
howToUse.step6: Use the augmented data to train or fine-tune AI models

rareConditions.title: Focus on Rare Conditions
rareConditions.text: The augmentation system is optimized for rare skin conditions that have limited training data:
rareConditions.examples: Dermatofibrosarcoma, Merkel cell carcinoma, Paget's disease, Porokeratosis, and 10+ other rare conditions

benefits.title: Benefits
benefits.benefit1: Improve model accuracy for underrepresented conditions
benefits.benefit2: Generate diverse training samples from limited data
benefits.benefit3: Preserve important diagnostic features while adding variation
benefits.benefit4: Support research into rare dermatological conditions

importantNotes.title: Important Notes
importantNotes.note1: Augmented images are synthetic and for training purposes only
importantNotes.note2: Original diagnostic features are preserved during augmentation
importantNotes.note3: Professional credentials may be required to access this feature
importantNotes.note4: Generated data should be used responsibly in accordance with research ethics

disclaimer.title: Important Medical Disclaimer
disclaimer.notSubstitute: This app is NOT a substitute for professional medical advice.
disclaimer.educationalOnly: The AI analysis is for educational and screening purposes only. Always consult a qualified dermatologist for:
disclaimer.changingLesions: Any lesion that is changing, bleeding, or concerning
disclaimer.regularScreenings: Regular skin cancer screenings if you're at high risk
disclaimer.aiMistakes: AI models can make mistakes. When in doubt, see a doctor.

proTips.title: Pro Tips
proTips.trackChangesText: Take photos of the same lesion every few weeks to monitor for growth, color changes, or other concerning developments.
proTips.completeHistoryText: Adding detailed information about medications, sun exposure, and family history helps your dermatologist make better decisions.
proTips.savePDFsText: Export and save analysis reports for your personal medical records or to bring to doctor appointments.
proTips.useQualityText: Higher quality photos lead to more accurate AI predictions. Retake the photo if quality check fails.

conditions.intro: The AI models can classify 31+ skin conditions, including:

regulatory.title: Regulatory Compliance
regulatory.subtitle: FDA & CE Mark Approval Pathways for AI/ML Medical Devices
regulatory.tooltipContent: This section outlines the regulatory pathways for AI-based medical devices in the US (FDA) and Europe (CE Mark). Understanding these requirements is essential for commercializing medical AI software.
regulatory.disclaimer: This application is currently for research and educational purposes only. It is NOT FDA-approved or CE-marked as a medical device. This information is provided for educational purposes about regulatory pathways.
regulatory.fdaTooltip: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulates medical devices in the United States through various pathways depending on risk classification and device type.
regulatory.classIIDescription: AI-based skin lesion analysis systems typically fall under Class II, requiring 510(k) premarket notification and demonstration of substantial equivalence to a predicate device.
regulatory.step1Description: Identify legally marketed device with similar intended use and technological characteristics
regulatory.step2Description: Conduct clinical studies demonstrating safety and effectiveness (typically 100-200+ patients)
regulatory.step3Description: Provide software validation per FDA guidance (IEC 62304, cybersecurity, algorithm transparency)
regulatory.step4Description: Submit comprehensive documentation including clinical data, software validation, and labeling
regulatory.step5Description: FDA review typically takes 90 days (may require additional information requests)
regulatory.keyFDARequirements: Key FDA Requirements for AI/ML Devices
regulatory.requirement1: Clinical validation with diagnostic accuracy metrics (sensitivity, specificity, PPV, NPV)
regulatory.requirement3: Training data documentation (sources, diversity, bias mitigation)
regulatory.requirement6: Post-market surveillance plan for model performance monitoring
regulatory.requirement7: Quality System Regulation (QSR) compliance (21 CFR Part 820)
regulatory.ceMarkTooltip: The CE Mark is required for medical devices sold in the European Union. The Medical Device Regulation (MDR) 2017/745 governs AI-based medical software.
regulatory.mdrDescription: Under MDR 2017/745, AI software for diagnosis typically qualifies as Class IIa (supporting diagnosis) or Class IIb (influencing patient management decisions). Classification depends on intended use and risk level.
regulatory.ceStep1Description: Apply MDR classification rules (especially Rule 11 for software)
regulatory.ceStep2Description: Engage EU-recognized Notified Body for conformity assessment (required for Class IIa/IIb)
regulatory.ceStep3Description: Prepare comprehensive technical file per MDR Annex II and III
regulatory.ceStep4Description: Conduct clinical evaluation per MDR Annex XIV (clinical data required)
regulatory.ceStep6Description: Issue DoC and affix CE mark after Notified Body approval
regulatory.keyMDRRequirements: Key MDR Requirements for AI/ML Devices
regulatory.mdrReq1: Clinical evaluation report with clinical data
regulatory.aimlTooltip: AI and machine learning medical devices have unique regulatory considerations including algorithm transparency, continuous learning, and bias mitigation.
regulatory.transparency1: Detailed description of algorithm architecture and training methodology
regulatory.transparency2: Training dataset characteristics (size, diversity, demographics, sources)
regulatory.transparency3: Explainability features (e.g., Grad-CAM heatmaps, attention maps)
regulatory.transparency4: Performance metrics across different patient populations
regulatory.learningDescription: FDA's "Predetermined Change Control Plan" allows certain algorithm modifications without new 510(k) submission. Requirements include:
regulatory.learning1: Pre-specified modification protocol in original submission
regulatory.bias1: Performance evaluation across demographic groups (age, sex, race, skin type)
regulatory.bias4: Ongoing bias monitoring in post-market surveillance
regulatory.fdaGuidanceLink: FDA.gov - Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Software as Medical Device
regulatory.guidanceLink: Good Machine Learning Practice for Medical Device Development (FDA, Health Canada, MHRA)

geneticTesting.title: Genetic Testing
geneticTesting.infoText: Upload genetic test reports to enhance your risk assessment. We support tests for melanoma-related genes including CDKN2A, CDK4, BAP1, and others.
geneticTesting.noTestsSubtext: Add your first genetic test to enhance your risk assessment
geneticTesting.pleaseSelectMutation: Please select at least one mutation or variant
geneticTesting.deleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this genetic test?

geneticRisk.title: Genetic Risk Assessment
geneticRisk.loadError: Failed to load genetic risk data

The PDF export feature will be available in the next update.

dermoscopy.title: Dermoscopy Mode
dermoscopy.subtitle: Enhanced Analysis for Dermatoscope Images
dermoscopy.dermoscopyDescription: Dermoscopy (also called dermatoscopy or epiluminescence microscopy) is a non-invasive diagnostic technique that allows in vivo evaluation of skin lesion colors and structures not visible to the naked eye.
dermoscopy.accuracyImprovement: Studies show dermoscopy improves melanoma detection accuracy by 20-30% compared to naked eye examination alone.
dermoscopy.magnificationDescription: Typically 10x to 100x magnification reveals subsurface structures
dermoscopy.illuminationDescription: Polarized or non-polarized light eliminates surface reflection
dermoscopy.patternAnalysisDescription: AI analyzes colors, structures, and patterns invisible to naked eye
dermoscopy.structuresSubtitle: Our AI automatically detects and analyzes these features:
dermoscopy.pigmentNetworkDescription: Net-like pigmented lines indicating melanocyte distribution
dermoscopy.dotsGlobulesDescription: Small circular melanin structures indicating cell clusters
dermoscopy.blueWhiteVeilDescription: Important melanoma indicator showing deeper melanin deposits
dermoscopy.radialStreaksDescription: Linear structures at lesion periphery suggesting growth
dermoscopy.vascularPatternsDescription: Blood vessel structures helping differentiate lesion types
dermoscopy.regressionStructuresDescription: Areas of healing or melanin loss indicating changes
dermoscopy.tip1Description: Requires specialized device or smartphone attachment (e.g., DermLite, Handyscope, iDerma)
dermoscopy.tip2Description: Place device flush against skin for clear magnified view
dermoscopy.tip3Description: Ensure entire lesion fits within circular field of view
dermoscopy.tip4Description: Keep device steady for sharp, clear image of structures
dermoscopy.tip5Description: Reduces glare and reveals deeper structures
dermoscopy.aiAnalysisDescription: When you upload a dermoscopy image, our AI system automatically:
dermoscopy.feature1: Detects dermoscopy image characteristics (circular field, polarization)
dermoscopy.feature2: Identifies all dermoscopic structures present in the lesion
dermoscopy.feature3: Analyzes patterns using 7-point checklist and ABCD criteria
dermoscopy.feature4: Provides clinical significance for each detected feature
dermoscopy.feature5: Combines with standard classification for comprehensive diagnosis
dermoscopy.sevenPointDescription:
Major criteria: atypical network, blue-white veil, atypical vascular pattern
Minor criteria: irregular streaks, irregular dots/globules, irregular blotches, regression structures
dermoscopy.abcdRuleDescription: Asymmetry, Border irregularity, Color variation, Dermoscopic structures
dermoscopy.menziesMethodDescription: Negative features (symmetry of pattern, single color) and positive features (blue-white veil, multiple brown dots, etc.)
dermoscopy.limitation1: â€¢ Dermoscopy requires training and experience to interpret correctly
dermoscopy.limitation2: â€¢ AI analysis is a screening tool, not a definitive diagnosis
dermoscopy.limitation3: â€¢ Some lesion types are difficult to classify even with dermoscopy
dermoscopy.limitation4: â€¢ Always consult a dermatologist for suspicious lesions
dermoscopy.limitation5: â€¢ Biopsy is the gold standard for melanoma diagnosis
dermoscopy.getStartedDescription: Upload a dermoscopy image from your device or capture one using a dermatoscope attachment. The AI will automatically detect and analyze dermoscopic structures.
